conclusion: For a straight conductor of length l moving with speed v perpendicular to a uniform magnetic field B, the motional emf is ε = Blv.
The rod is bent into two perpendicular segments, each of length l/2, forming an L-shape in a plane perpendicular to B.
The rod as a single conducting path moves with speed v along the bisector of the right angle, with velocity component perpendicular to each segment being v/√2.
The emf generated along each straight segment is ε₁ = B (v/√2)(l/2) and ε₂ = B (v/√2)(l/2).
These two emfs add to give ε′ = ε₁ + ε₂ = 2 · B (v/√2)(l/2) = B vl/√2.
